intro: Panicum cognatum, commonly known as yellow panicgrass, is a warm-season grass native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and its ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade. The plant produces fluffy, yellowish-green seed heads that are often used in ornamental landscaping. It is drought-tolerant and prefers well-drained soils, making it a low-maintenance choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its attractive foliage and seasonal color changes.
